title: Fantastic Voyage movie poster font
content:
[http://www.telerobotics.utah.edu/uploads/Main/FatasticVoyagePoster.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20091008034606/http:/www.telerobotics.utah.edu/uploads/Main/FatasticVoyagePoster.jpg "http://www.telerobotics.utah.edu/uploads/Main/FatasticVoyagePoster.jpg")

The title font.

Under pressure of time.

Thank you.
author: Christopher Dean

comments.content: Manually obliquing\* [Morgan Tower](http://web.archive.org/web/20091008034606/http:/www.vllg.com/Feliciano/Morgan/mudTyper+Weights/) might get you close. (\*I know this is not ideal but...)
I’m pretty sure I saw that G and A somewhere in a Star Trek collection, but I’ll be darned if I can find it. Perhaps my old Letraset catalogues?
It does look familar, but the movie is predigital. Could have been a photolettering font. Letraset might be a good place to look.
